result.execSummary:
The defendant Coleman L Randall was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Coleman L Randall is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Coleman L Randall was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

ADDRESS INFO for Coleman L Randall
Current: 193 South Brook St., Fond du Lac, WI 54935 United States  (Effective: 06-06-2016)
Prior: 2842 Village Rd Apt A, Portage, WI 53901 United States
Columbia County Court Conviction DNA - DNA taken
Filed by Attorney Tristan Eagon
Filed by Attorney Tristan Eagon

Defendant Coleman L Randall in court with attorney Tristan F Eagon.  Christine Marie Genda appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State orally requested the domestic enhancer on Ct. 1 be removed.  Court granted request.  Rights/Elements.  Defendant pled no contest to Ct. 1 with enhancer removed.  Court found guilty.  Judgment was entered.  Ct. 2 dismissed.  On Ct. 1 Court sentenced defendant to pay $579.00 fines and costs.  60 days to pay or set up a payment plan with Clerk of Courts.  Bond on hand to be applied towards fine and costs.  Submit DNA sample. 1 day credit.
Amending bond to no violent/abusive contact w/the victim

3:31 P.M. Defendant Coleman L Randall in court with attorney Tristan F Eagon.  Crystal N Long appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Long states she has not received a response from the victim on contact with the defendant, State takes no position, Court modifies bond to no violent/abusive contact w/A.R. 3:38 P.M.
Bail/bond hearing at 02-01-2016 03:30 pm
